title: A man walks 50 m towards South from his house and turn right and walk 60 m, then turns left and went to 30 m, again he turns right and walks 120 m. How far is he away from his starting point? - Quora

response.answer_text: Statement of the given problem,(i) A man walks 50 m towards South from his house(ii) and turn right and walk 60 m (= towards West)(iii) then turns left and went to 30 m (= towards South)(iv) again he turns right and walks 120 m (= towards West)(v) How far is he away from his starting point?Let D1, D2, D3 & D4 denote the displacement vectors described in (i), (ii), (iii) & (iv) respectively.Let R denotes the resultant displacement vector, obtained from vector additions of D1, D2, D3 & D4.Representing in 2-dimensional rectangular component forms we get,R = (Rx)i + (Ry)jD1 = 0i - 50j || D2 = - 60i + 0j || D3 = 0i - 30j || D4 = - 120i + 0jHence we get the following relation,(Rx)i + (Ry)j = (0i - 50j) + (- 60i + 0j) + (0i - 30j) + (- 120i + 0j)or (Rx)i + (Ry)j = - 180i - 80jor Rx = - 180 and Ry = - 80Therefore we get,magnitude of resultant displacement= √[(- 180)^2 + (- 80)^2] = 181.11 (m)direction of resultant displacement= tan-inverse [(- 80)/(- 180)] = 23.96° (south-westerly third quadrant)

Vector 1 = 50 m southward ; vector 2 = 60 m eastward; vector 3 is equal to 30 m southward and vector 4 = 120 eastward. Adding these 4 vectors gives the resultant R as equal to 197 m directed to 336 degrees or 24 degrees from the eastward direction. After the first right turn the person faces east , after the next left turn, he faces south, and finally he faces east after turning right. He is 197 meters from his starting point.
